info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 8:31PM MST until July 15 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Areas along I-40 near Winslow.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Colorado River, Jacks Canyon, Chevelon Canyon, McDonald Canyon, Cottonwood Wash and Clear Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winslow, Clear Creek Reservoir, Bushman Acres, Homolovi Ruins State Park, Hibbard, Winslow-Lindbergh Regional Airport, McHood Park, Winslow City Park, Sacred Heart Park, Standin' on the Corner Park, Coopertown Park and West Winslow. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 251 and 266. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 252 and 257. State Route 99 between mile markers 38 and 42. State Route 87 between mile markers 341 and 348. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING
